result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Ellen Belt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa Ellen Belt

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
AND ARRAIGNMENT 10:00 AM Defendant Lisa Ellen Belt in court.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jaramy J Hansen in court for Lisa Ellen Belt. Court calls case. State indicates a resolution. Plea to count 1. Fine of $50 plus court costs, 52 days jail with 39 days credit, time served with good time. State indicates that probation is not necessary due to the defendant already being on extended supervision until 2027. 
Defendant pleads no contest. State has complied with victim's rights. Attorney Hansen stipulates to a factual basis and is satisfied that the defendant understands her rights. Court accepts the plea. Court finds that the defendant's plea is knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction is entered.
State has no further comments. Attorney Hansen has no further comments. 
Court orders a sentence of 52 days jail with 39 days credit, time served with good time.  $50 plus court costs, 120 days to pay.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:45 AM Defendant Lisa Ellen Belt in court.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jaramy J Hansen in court for Lisa Ellen Belt, in custody. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lisa Ellen Belt
Current: 1716 Oakes Avenue, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 03-29-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Superior, WI 54880

3:28 PM Defendant Lisa Ellen Belt appeared by video, in custody with Jaclyn Shelton.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Address verified as 1716 Oakes Avenue, Superior, WI.  Attorney acknowledges receipt, waives reading, requests preliminary hearing.  State requests $200 cash. On a DOC hold. Conditions of no driving without valid permit or license, no frequenting bars or liquor stores where primary purpose is sale of alcohol. Cites priors. No objection to court ordering signature bond in the alternative.
Attorney Shelton indicates cash not necessary. Currently on probation hold, Douglas county resident last 15 years. Asks for no conditions.
Court orders $2,000 signature bond. No special conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:45 am.
